title: Aomori tops Japan festival destination
text:
Aomori tops Japan festival destination 19 Jul 2015 at 20:41 54 viewed 0 comments WRITER: KYODO NEWS 
File photo taken in August 2014 shows the Nebuta festival held every summer in Aomori, northeastern Japan. (Kyodo photo) - + Spending by tourists to Japan hits record TOKYO â€” Aomori in northeastern Japan is the most popular prefecture for festivals, surpassing Kyoto prefecture, one of the top tourist destinations in the world, a survey by a major domestic travel agency showed. 
Nearly 30% of 2,508 respondents picked Aomori where the Nebuta festival is held every summer, while some 22% chose Kyoto in western Japan, famous for its Gion festival, JTB Corp said on July 10. 
The Nebuta festival, famous for its nightly parades of illuminated giant paper floats, will be held Aug 2 to 7 this year. The Gion festival, best known for its parade of elaborately decorated floats, is held during July. 
The northernmost island prefecture of Hokkaido, where snow festivals are held in February, came in third with 12% voting for it, JTB said. 
"We think there is plenty of scope for organising festival-themed tours," a JTB official said.
